greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Period of the first difference of Ulam 1-additive sequence U(2,2n+1).
comment: It was proved by Akeran that a(2^k-1) = 3^(k+1) - 1.
Note that a(n)=2^(2n+1) as soon as A100730(n)=2^(2n+3)-2, that happens for n=(m-2)/2 with m>=6 being an even element of A073639.
link: Max Alekseyev, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..31
J. Cassaigne and S. R. Finch, A class of 1-additive sequences and additive recurrences
S. R. Finch, Patterns in 1-additive sequences, Experimental Mathematics 1 (1992), 57-63.
xref: Cf. A100730 for the fundamental difference, A001857 for U(2, 3), A007300 for U(2, 5), A003668 for U(2, 7).
results.author: _Ralf Stephan_, Dec 03 2004
ext: a(3) corrected from 25 to 26 by _Hugo van der Sanden_ and Bertram Felgenhauer (int-e(AT)gmx.de), Nov 11 2007
